name: voluminously
content:
voluminously adverb
(OF WRITING/SPEAKING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves writing or speaking a lot, often in great detail: She is a highly respected researcher who has written voluminously on this subject. He did not just talk - he declaimed, grandly and voluminously.
More examplesFewer examplesHe wrote voluminously about baseball, in particular about baseball in Chicago.

voluminously adverb
(PRODUCING)
in a way that involves producing or using a great amount of something: She recorded voluminously - according to his website, over a hundred discs. He smoked heavily and drank voluminously before giving up alcohol in the 1990s.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dog was voluminously sick on the carpet.

voluminously adverb
(OF CLOTHING)
used for saying that a piece of clothing is large and consists of a lot of cloth: She wore voluminously baggy trousers. On stage, he was known for wearing voluminously collared shirts.
More examplesFewer examplesThe voluminously robed actor dashes about the desert in this epic film.
